byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Garland, and Manny Fernandez and Alan Blinder from Dallas. Reporting was contributed by Richard Pérez-Peña and Christopher Mele from New York; John Eligon and David Montgomery from Mesquite, Tex.; and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from Chicago. Jack Begg and Elisa Cho contributed research.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET, MANNY FERNANDEZ and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Officials say former Army serviceman Micah Johnson, who fatally shot five police officers and wounded nine people in Dallas, practiced military skills and carefully planned attack; reveal Johnson's journal described combat tactic known as 'shoot and move,' which was strikingly similar to ones he used during shooting.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Johnson, who killed five police officers, wrote about a combat tactic known as “shoot and move” and rehearsed in his backyard, officials said.

headline.main: Micah Johnson, Gunman in Dallas, Honed Military Skills to a Deadly Conclusion
headline.print_headline: Gunman Honed Military Skills to Deadly Conclusion in Dallas

snippet: Mr. Johnson, who killed five police officers, wrote about a combat tactic known as “shoot and move” and rehearsed in his backyard, officials said....

keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
